m:MaterialRow.demo:PrettyPre:
<!-- Addin Import -->
xmlns:ma="urn:import:gwt.material.design.addins.client"
<!-- Addin Usage -->
<combobox:MaterialComboBox>
<m:html.Option value="1" text="Sample 1"/>
<m:html.Option value="2" text="Sample 2"/>
<m:html.Option value="3" text="Sample 3"/>
</combobox:MaterialComboBox>

m:MaterialTitle.title: Label and Placeholder
m:MaterialTitle.description: On Combo Box we have two types of labeling your component. They are label and placeholder.

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre: <combobox:MaterialComboBox ui:field="comboTimeZone2" closeOnSelect="false" multiple="true" label="This is label" placeholder="This is placeholder" />

m:MaterialTitle.title: Placeholder : Singe Selection
m:MaterialTitle.description: Note that because browsers assume the first option element is selected in non-multi-value select boxes an empty first option element must be provided for the placeholder to work.

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre:
<combobox:MaterialComboBox placeholder="This is a placeholder" allowClear="true">
<m:html.Option text="" />
<m:html.Option text="Item 1" />
<m:html.Option text="Item 2" />
<m:html.Option text="Item 3" />
</combobox:MaterialComboBox>

m:MaterialTitle.title: Java : Adding Options
m:MaterialTitle.description: Populating your data can be done using java. By calling combobox.addItem(String, T)

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre: <combobox:MaterialComboBox ui:field="combobox" label="This is label" placeholder="This is placeholder" />

m:MaterialTitle.title: Java : Adding Options plus OptGroup
m:MaterialTitle.description: You can add an optgroup easily by calling combobox.addGroup(OptionGroup)

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre: <combobox:MaterialComboBox ui:field="combobox" label="This is label" placeholder="This is placeholder" />

m:MaterialTitle.title: Allow Clear
m:MaterialTitle.description: We added a built in clear icon to easily clear all items on Multiple Combobox

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre: <combobox:MaterialComboBox ui:field="comboTimeZone3" placeholder="TimeZone" closeOnSelect="false" multiple="true" allowClear="true" />

m:MaterialTitle.title: With OptGroup
m:MaterialTitle.description: Just like on java way of adding optgroup, we have also added it on UiBinder way.

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre:
<combobox:MaterialComboBox ui:field="comboTimeZone" placeholder="TimeZone">
<m:html.OptGroup label="Group 1">
<m:html.Option text="Sample 1"/>
<m:html.Option text="Sample 2"/>
<m:html.Option text="Sample 3"/>
</m:html.OptGroup>
<m:html.OptGroup label="Group 2">
<m:html.Option text="Sample 1.1"/>
<m:html.Option text="Sample 2.1"/>
<m:html.Option text="Sample 3.1"/>
</m:html.OptGroup>
</combobox:MaterialComboBox>

m:MaterialTitle.title: Multiple Select
m:MaterialTitle.description: Just like Autocomplete you can have a capability to select ComboBox options multiple.

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre: <combobox:MaterialComboBox closeOnSelect="false" multiple="true" ui:field="comboTimeZone4" placeholder="TimeZone"/>

m:MaterialTitle.title: Disabled
m:MaterialTitle.description: You can disabled your combobox by adding enabled='false'

m:MaterialTitle.title: Disabling Result
m:MaterialTitle.description: You can disable each Option by adding enabled'false'

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre:
<combobox:MaterialComboBox ui:field="comboDisable" placeholder="Time Zone">
<m:html.Option text="Item 1"></m:html.Option>
<m:html.Option enabled="false" text="Item 2 (disabled)"></m:html.Option>
<m:html.Option text="Item 3"></m:html.Option>
</combobox:MaterialComboBox>

m:MaterialTitle.title: Limit
m:MaterialTitle.description: You can set the item limit on multiple combobox.

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre: <combobox:MaterialComboBox closeOnSelect="false" multiple="true" limit="2" placeholder="Time Zone" ui:field="comboTimeZone7" />

m:MaterialTitle.title: Tag Support
m:MaterialTitle.description: Note that when tagging is enabled the user can select from pre-existing options or create a new tag by picking the first choice, which is what the user has typed into the search box so far. Also Tag support will only work on String generic Params.

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre: <combobox:MaterialComboBox tags="true" closeOnSelect="false" multiple="true" placeholder="Time Zone" />

m:MaterialTitle.title: Close On Select
m:MaterialTitle.description: Allow or Prevent the dropdown from closing when a result is selected (Default : true)

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre: <combobox:MaterialComboBox closeOnSelect="false" multiple="true" placeholder="Time Zone" ui:field="comboCloseOnSelect" />

m:MaterialTitle.title: Value Change Event
m:MaterialTitle.description: This event will be fired when changing values on combobox

m:MaterialTitle.title: Selection Event
m:MaterialTitle.description: This event will be fired when Selecting values on combobox

m:MaterialTitle.title: Remove Item Event
m:MaterialTitle.description: This event will be fired when removing item/value on multiple combobox

m:MaterialTitle.title: Open / Close Event for Simple
m:MaterialTitle.description: This event will be fired when opening / closing the combobox

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre: <combobox:MaterialComboBox placeholder="Time Zone" ui:field="comboTimeZone10" />

m:MaterialTitle.title: Get Selected Value / Values
m:MaterialTitle.description: We provided a way to get values from simple and multiple combobox.

m:MaterialColumn.demo:PrettyPre:
// For simple combobox
combobox.getSingleValue() // Returns single value

// For multiple combobox
combobox.getSelectedValues() // Returns lists of values

m:MaterialTitle.title: Set Value / Values
m:MaterialTitle.description: setValue() will be applied on Simple while setValues() can be applied on Multiple combobox

m:MaterialTitle.title: Programmatic Access
m:MaterialTitle.description: MaterialCombobox supports methods that allow programmatic control of the component.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Initialization update
m:MaterialTitle.description: You might need to reinitialize your combobox if you want to update the combobox list items

m:MaterialTitle.title: Dialog Integration
m:MaterialTitle.description: You can easily put your combobox inside dialog easily

m:MaterialTitle.title: Scroll To Top
m:MaterialTitle.description: You can set easily the position of ComboBox dropdown results scroll position to top.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Provide your Custom Message Text
m:MaterialTitle.description: This is good for Language support so that you can easily control the text object in your combobox..
